column4: I am importing a bunch of songs both mp3s and wmas, The files are in one folder names music, then with a seperate folder the main for each artist with the songs in there. Is there a simple scripts that will run through the whole thing recursively and delete all the wmas
Let me check I think I tried that
or better yet is there a way to just copy out all the mp3s to another folder
find can help with both of those
for i in */*; do echo cp \"$i\" \"`basename $i`\"; done
that will output the copy commands so you can check it, then save the output and run it, or change that to actually do it
for i in */*.mp3; do echo cp \"$i\" \"`basename $i`\"; done
that should be very close, save that output and check it, then run it
this giving things like this basename: extra operand `Massacre'
you'll have to debug it yourself, it's working for me and all of my music (including japenses characters and tons of long names with spaces)
you might need the execdir like someone else mentioned
